content:
⚠️ Modified the contribution.
Comment: 
Changed constraint "1 <= [[Day]] <= 1000" to
"5 <= [[Day]] <= 1000" since none of the test cases currently test numbers below 7. For Shortest mode, this makes a huge difference, because dealing with cases with [[Day]] = 1 or 2 would possibly throw errors if you have taken shortcuts in your code.
Also, made a minor grammar edit "With [[Rabbit]] rabbit being..." -> "With [[Rabbit]] rabbits being...".

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it, easy to solve, fun to clash with

First, I like the idea. It is more original than many clashes.

But I am sorry; I have to disagree with the previous comments. For me the problem is not clear. I think that the proposed solution does not match the description.

How I understood the problem:
- There are R rabbits born on the first day.
- In the second day, these R rabbits will "create" R*B babies.

How you solved the problem:
- There are R rabbits born on the first day.
- No new rabbit born on day 2
- On day 3, the R rabbits finally "create" babies.

@Alex-1 and @Flaaamort Did you try to solve the problem *before* looking at the solution? Was it really clear for you? I am asking, because I may be the only one who is confused :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice i like the idea and concept well done :smile:

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy, fun and clear.
Good job :)
One more thing; the first testcase should be for 1 (or at most 2) day(s) so that people can debug their solution.
